edu.rit.se.swen383.audio

Class AudioSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.se.swen383.audio.AudioSource

  • public class AudioSource
extends java.lang.Object
    AudioSource objects encapsulate an MP3 file and provide access to the file name as well as tag information found in MP3 files.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AudioSource(java.lang.String filename)
      Create a new AudioSource object from the contents of the file named by the String argument.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
      Two AudioSource objects are equal if they reference the same filename.
      java.lang.String getAlbum()
      Retrieve the album name for this MP3 source (null string if no album name).
      java.lang.String getArtist()
      Retrieve the artist name for this MP3 source (null string if no artist).
      int getDuration()
      Retrieve the duration of this MP3 source (in seconds).
      java.lang.String getFileName()
      Retrieve the file name of this MP3 source.
      java.lang.String getGenre()
      Retrieve the genre of this MP3 source (null string if no genre).
      java.lang.String getTitle()
      Retrieve the title of this MP3 source (null string if no title).

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • AudioSource

        public AudioSource(java.lang.String filename)
            throws AudioSourceException
        Create a new AudioSource object from the contents of the file named by the String argument. An exception is thrown if the file cannot be opened or if it does not contain MP3 data.
        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the file used by this AudioSource
        Throws:
        AudioSourceException - if the string does not name a legitimate MP3 file.

    • Method Detail

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Two AudioSource objects are equal if they reference the same filename.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - the object with which to make a comparison.
        Returns:
        true iff o is an AudioSource and it has the same filename as this

        filename
